components.description:
The face of a dragon, a mythical creature resembling a giant reptile found in the folklore of many cultures. Depicted as a green, Chinese-styled dragon looking straight ahead or facing left. Often shown with huge nostrils, baring large teeth and a red tongue, with antler-like structures on its head, whisker-like tendrils by its nostrils, and a green or yellow mane.

See also üêâ Dragon. One of the 12 animals of the Chinese zodiac. Commonly used on Chinese New Year and St. George's Day. Also used for various medieval and fantasy content.

Available as an Apple Animoji.

Microsoft's dragon face was previously red and looking straight ahead. Samsung's dragon face previously resembled a red, friendly, cartoon-styled imp with horns.
components.title: Dragon Face

title: Dragon Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal faces
emoji_net_data.definition: The face of a dragon, showing only the head. Most platforms display this in green, looking similar to a dinosaur.¬†The dragon face emoji is s http://emojipedia.org/dragon-face/
emoji_net_data.name: dragon face

bn:00099614a: Of or pertaining to China or its peoples or cultures
Of China, its languages or people
Of or relating to China, peoples from China or their languages.

bn:00088378v: Travel through the air; be airborne
To cause to travel through the air.
To cause to fly : to transport via air or the like.
To move autonomously through the air, without any part of the object or object's enclosure touching anything attached to the ground.

bn:00028587n: The largest lizard in the world (10 feet); found on Indonesian islands

Varanus komodoensis, an endangered species of monitor lizard native to certain Indonesian islands east of Java, the world's largest lizard, growing to 10 feet or 3 meters, known for its ability to kill prey with its septic saliva.
A large species of lizard found in the Indonesian islands of Komodo
The Komodo dragon, also known as the Komodo monitor, is a large species of lizard found in the Indonesian islands of Komodo, Rinca, Flores, Gili Motang, and Padar.
Large species of lizard found in Indonesia

bn:00028582n: A legendary serpentine or reptilian creature.
A mythical creature typically depicted as a large horned serpent (Asia) or a winged, fire-breathing reptile (Europe), with magical or spiritual qualities.
A Dragon is a legendary creature, typically with serpentine or reptilian traits, which exist in the myths of many cultures.
A dragon is a legendary creature, typically with serpentine or reptilian traits, that features in the myths of many cultures.
A creature of Teutonic mythology; usually represented as breathing fire and having a reptilian body and sometimes wings

bn:00018452n: A Sino-Tibetan language spoken mainly in China and the surrounding regions and countries.
P t?s?), tribal leaders recognized or appointed by the Chinese over nearby peoples
The logographic writing system shared by this language family.
Any of the Sino-Tibetan languages spoken in China; regarded as dialects of a single language (even though they are mutually unintelligible) because they share an ideographic writing system
Chinese is a group of related but in many cases mutually unintelligible language varieties, forming a branch of the Sino-Tibetan language family.
